page.title: 04Housing Scheme-"The Cearns".
page.content: This scheme was built in 1974. It comprises of 217 terraced houses and 24 flats, built in blocks of 12 courts each court named in Gaelic after one of the multiplicity of small islands dotted around the Western Isles coastline. The Gaelic word for court is"cearn,"hence the local designation for the scheme-"The Cearns." The court names are e.g.Cearns Ronaidh,Phabaidh, Easaidh,Hiort etc. The houses are 3 and 4 apt.,housing in the main, families of 4 and 6,with an average weekly rent of Â£22. Amenities include a shop,3 swing parks, a nursery school,junior and senior youthclubs and a Sunday fellowship. About 3 years ago,8 blocks of semi-detatched 4 apt. houses were added to the scheme,thus bringing the population total in "The Cearns"to approximately 1600.
